basics.name: Alyssia Chen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences; a B.B.A in Marketing at the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii; and a B.A. minor at the Department of Psychology. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

courses: BUS 310 - 	Statistical Analysis for Business Decisions
BUS 311 - Information Systems for Global Business Environments
BUS 313 - Economics & Finanical Environment of Global Business
ACC 200/210 - Introduction to Accounting I & II
COMG 251 - Principles of Efficient Public Speaking
ICS 101 - Tools for the Information World
ITM 387K - Advanced Topics in Information System: Business Intelligence

highlights: Use C# to build a tool that can create xml files that adheres to federal and state-given schemas
Assist with service requests for the Gentax application
Utilize content management system WordPress, the email delivery vendor Mailchimp, and the Hawaii State Calendar of Events
Gained hands-on experience (statistical analysis, data visualization) with R
Created and developed research questions related to health analytics based on a national dataset
Learned how to conduct reproducible, replicable, and ethical research

work.summary: Help principal investigators with their research
highlights: Managed a database of parents to contact for the studies once their children are eligible
Improved efficiency of a database by creating codes and automating processes
Read and assessed pertinent research articles related to child development and social psychology at weekly lab meetings
Wrote basic code to analyze the effectiveness of educational philosophy in R
